intro: Ruellia cooperi, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in terminal panicles, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Ruellia cooperi is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile choice for landscaping.
